report.name: hardcode
report.label: Dummy
report.description: This shows that a report may be hard-coded, which in itself is boring, but proves that Java of any kind can create the report.

report.name: paramsql
report.label: ParamSql
report.description: This shows the usage of parameters, and binding of a parameter to a list of options. This report lets you search on Issue Type and Reporter for Simple JNDI issues.
report.sql: select * from jiraissue where pkey like 'SJN%' and reporter=? and issuetype=?

param.name: reporter
param.label: Reporter
param.description: The reporter of the JIRA issue.

report.name: datesql
report.label: DateSql
report.description: This report shows the calendar widget which allows the weblog entries between two times to be seen. It also shows the usage of columns to specify what the headers and format of the report columns will be.
report.sql: select id, title, text, pubtime from weblogentry where pubtime between ? and ?

report.name: bookmarks
report.label: Bookmarks
report.description: A report to show typed parameters and columns. Much of the code for this is unimplemented.
report.sql: select name, url from bookmark where priority = ?

param.name: rolename
param.description: The role name of the user role; most likely author.
